Module org.example._50zo
Package Model.Players

Class PlayerGPU

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
Model.Players.AdapterPlayers
Model.Players.PlayerGPU
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, IPlayers
public class PlayerGPU extends AdapterPlayers
Represents an AI-controlled player (GPU) in the card game. This class extends AdapterPlayers and defines the behavior of a non-human player that plays automatically during its turn. It runs as a separate thread, synchronizing its actions with other players through a shared lock mechanism. The GPU player is capable of: Waiting for its turn before taking any action. Validating and playing cards according to game rules. Drawing new cards when necessary. Returning all its cards to the deck when eliminated. Updating the game interface asynchronously using Platform.runLater(Runnable).
Since:
2025

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerGPU

      public PlayerGPU(Deck deck, int myTurn, Object lock, TurnManager turnManager, CardPile cardPile, GameWindowController controller)
      Constructs a new GPU player.
      Parameters:
      deck - the main deck used to draw or return cards
      myTurn - the player's assigned turn number
      lock - a shared synchronization object to manage turns safely
      turnManager - the object responsible for controlling the game turns
      cardPile - the shared pile of cards where players place their cards
      controller - the controller responsible for UI updates

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Main execution method of the GPU player. The method runs continuously in a separate thread while isPlaying is true. It waits for its turn, plays a valid card, draws a new one, and passes control to the next player. The method ensures thread-safety using the lock object and updates the interface on the JavaFX application thread.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

    • returnCardsToDecK

      public void returnCardsToDecK()
      Returns all cards from this player's hand back into the main deck. This method is typically used when a player is eliminated or leaves the game. It ensures that the cards are reintroduced into the deck and shuffled.

    • setTurn

      public void setTurn(int turn)
      Sets the turn number for this player.
      Parameters:
      turn - the new turn number assigned to the player
